results.title: The Marriage of Maria Braun = die ehe der Maria Braun
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Michael Fengler, Albatros, Filmverlag der Autoren, Trio and WDR
results.brief_description: A tragicomedy spanning a decade which begins with the wedding of Maria Braun amid the chaos of an Allied bomb attack in 1943. Within 24 hours Maria’s husband is sent to the Russian front. Initially naive and idealistic, Maria increasingly adjusts to male values using her sexuality resourcefully but cynically in the pursuit of wealth and power. Yet she retains a romantic yearning for reunion with her missing husband which prevents her from fully living in the present. Fassbinder clearly means the film to be seen as an allegory about the German ‘economic miracle’ - the deep-seated continuity between past and present. Schygulla’s performance is deliberately dead-pan, taking the melodramatic mode to its limits, and reflecting Fassbinder’s interest in the melodramas of Douglas Sirk. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Bullitt
results.creator_credit: Peter Yates, Philip D'Antoni and Solar Productions
results.brief_description: Steve McQueen plays the title role as Frank Bullitt, a no-glitter, all-guts cop who is assigned to protect Chicago gangster Johnny Ross (Pat Renella), who is scheduled to testify against his mob cronies in San Francisco. But after Ross is attacked and later killed at the hospital, Bullitt conceals Ross’s death and begins to investigate the case himself, sensing something suspicious. One of the most memorable scenes in Bullitt is the celebrated car chase through the streets of San Francisco. McQueen, an expert automobile and motorcycle racer, does his own stunt driving as he propels his high-performance Mustang around and over San Francisco’s fabled hills. Cast includes Jacqueline Bisset, Robert Vaughn, Don Gordon and Robert Duvall.

results.title: From dusk till dawn
results.creator_credit: Robert Rodriguez, Gianni Nunnari, Meir Teper and A Band Apart
results.brief_description: After pulling off a bloody Texas bank heist, notorious bank robber Seth Gecko and his homicidal, rape-happy brother Ritchie, secure a safe passage across the border into Mexico thanks to the unwilling aid of disillusioned ex-minister Jacob Fuller. After kidnapping the Fuller family, the Gecko brothers elude the authorities and reach a supposed safe haven at a pre-chosen site: a surreal and ultra-sleazy bar in the middle of the desert, where they plan to split the loot with their Mexican connection. Unfortunately, the club is actually a haven for ferocious Aztec vampires; a twist which spins the schizophrenic plot into its second phase. Cast includes George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Harvey Keitel and Juliette Lewis.

results.title: The Italian job
results.creator_credit: Peter Collinson, Michael Deeley and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: When Charlie (Michael Caine) leaves jail he has the opportunity for a better future, or a sure fire way of landing back in jail when he inherits the plans to a $4,000,000 gold robbery. Things look positive when Charlie receives inside help from prison-based Mr Bridger (Noel Coward), who is the mastermind behind the plan. Central to the plan’s success is staging the world’s biggest traffic jam as a diversion to their shady activities. Cast includes Benny Hill, Raf Vallone and Tony Beckley. Music by Quincy Jones.

results.title: Deconstructing Harry
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Jean Doumanian, Magnolia Productions and Sweetland Films BV
results.brief_description: Harry (Woody Allen), a New York author, has just released his latest novel “loosely” based on the characters from his own life - his ex-wives, mistresses, family and analysts. No-one likes his depiction of them, and in an hilariously ironic mixture of flashbacks to his new novel, flashbacks to his past, and mishaps in the present, the true story comes out. In classic Allen style, this autobiographical story is a fascinating mixture of fiction and reality. The cast is another line-up of characters in itself, including Kirstie Alley, Demi Moore, Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Elisabeth Shue, Stanley Tucci, Amy Irving, Julie Kavner, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Mariel Hemingway and Judy Davis.

results.title: Cover girl
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Arthur Schwartz and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A chorus girl is given a chance for stardom when she is befriended by a wealthy magazine editor who used to be in love with her mother. She is torn betweeen loyalty and the secret love she has for the nightclub manager where she works, and leaving for the bright lights and fortune that will await her as a cover girl. She is faced with a difficult choice between love and fame, or can she have both? Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly who play the star crossed lovers are well supported by Phil Silvers and Eve Arden. (Awards: Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin for Best Musical Score)

results.title: Tonight and every night
results.brief_description: Rita Hayworth stars as Rosalind Bruce, a charismatic entertainer who, along with her showgirl colleagues, attempts to bring light relief from the ravages of war torn Britain. Romance develops between Rosalind and an RAF pilot Paul (Lee Bowman), who she meets during an air raid. Their relationship forms a delightful backdrop to the many entertaining musical numbers. Cast includes Janet Blair, Marc Platt, Leslie Brooks and Shelley Winters. Based on a play by Leslie Storm.

results.title: Affair in Trinidad
results.brief_description: An American woman working as a dancer in Trinidad with her artist husband (Neil Emery), is gradually drawn into a web of secret police deals and espionage when her husband is found dead, believed murdered. She, the only ‘key’, is used to obtain evidence against his murderers. His brother arrives to be confronted by his brother’s death. Suspicious, he seeks to find out the truth, falling in love with his dead brother’s wife on the way. Cast includes Rita Hayworth, Glenn Ford, Alexander Scourby and Valerie Bettis (who was also responsible for choreographing Rita Hayworth’s dance sequences). Costume designer Jean Louis was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Costume.

results.title: The Planter's wife = outpost in Malaya
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, John Stafford and Pinnacle Productions
results.brief_description: The setting is Malaya in the 50’s, still a British colonial outpost, but on the verge of independence and a new Malaya. The major industry is rubber, and the majority of this control still lies with the British. Jim Frazer (Jack Hawkins) and his wife Liz (Claudette Colbert) have built a successful rubber plantation business. Liz is dissatisfied with her lifestyle and resents having to move from her social circle following her marriage. There are bigger issues at stake however, when their lives come under threat from Malay bandits, intent on usurping British rule. Fearing for his son’s safety, Jim organizes for his wife and son to return to England. Liz misinterprets her husband’s intentions for their departure and vows never to return to Malaya. She is not given the opportunity to leave however, as a surprise attack forces the family into a battle for survival. Cast includes Anthony Steel, Jeremey Spenser and Ram Gopal.

results.title: The King of Marvin Gardens
results.brief_description: Radio personality David Staebler (Jack Nicholson), uses his brother’s life story as fodder for his radio ramblings, thus anticipating the “talk jocks” of the 1980’s and 90’s. David’s brother Jason (Bruce Dern), is full of lofty ambitions but lacks the wherewithal to accomplish them. He has managed to survive for so long thanks to the help of his older brother. His latest vision for success involves building a resort on a small Hawaiian island and he intends to raise the capital by holding a beauty contest and wining and dining rich Japanese businessmen. Along with Jason’s long suffering wife (Ellen Burstyn), David reluctantly agrees to support his brother one more time.
